case_vignette: a 67-year-old-male farmer presents complaining of a growing mole on the right side of his cheek.   he states the mole was present for several years, but then started growing rapidly on one side a few weeks ago. sometimes the mole will bleed on its own. he tries to avoid picking at the area.   physical examination shows tan-brown ovoid irreuglarly shaped hyperpigmented macule with focal ulcearion. dermoscopy demonstrates a blue-gray veil in the center of the lesion.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a mole on my right cheek that has started growing rapidly on one side and sometimes it bleeds on its own.
When did you first notice this mole and the changes happening to it?
I first noticed the mole several years ago, but it started growing rapidly and changing a few weeks ago.
Have you experienced any other skin changes or symptoms elsewhere on your body?
No, I have not experienced any other skin changes or symptoms elsewhere on my body.
Do you have a history of sun exposure or sunburns, especially in your childhood or adolescence?
I am a farmer, so I have had significant sun exposure throughout my life.
Do you have any family history of skin cancer or any other related conditions?
I don't know of any family history of skin cancer or related conditions.
Final Diagnosis: Malignant Melanoma
